item.title: Axis Bank, Bajaj Electricals among 33 stocks to hit 52-week low today; check full list - Upstox
item.description:
Axis Bank, Bajaj Electricals Among 33 Stocks to Hit 52-Week Low Today

Publication Date: January 17, 2024

Source: National Stock Exchange of India (NSE)

As many as 33 stocks hit their lowest levels in 52 weeks on the NSE amid a negative trading environment. Notable stocks include Axis Bank and Bajaj Electricals, which both reported significant declines due to various factors, including weak earnings and tax issues.

  • Axis Bank Ltd: 52-week low of ₹974.6; shares fell 6.1% after weak quarterly earnings.
  • Bajaj Electricals Ltd: 52-week low of ₹719.1; shares down 1.7% due to tax demand decision.
  • Relaxo Footwears Ltd: 52-week low of ₹569.5; shares declined 1.3% amid ongoing drops in the market.
“Axis Bank’s growth in advances and deposits for the quarter was the slowest in the last 15 quarters.”

In addition to Axis Bank and Bajaj Electricals, other stocks similarly affected include HIL Ltd, Jai Balaji Industries Ltd, and Relaxo Footwears Ltd.

item.title: Hero Xpulse 210 launched at Rs 1.76 lakh at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025 - BikeWale
item.description:
Hero Xpulse 210 Launched at Rs 1.76 Lakh at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025

Publication Date: Not Specified | Source: BikeWale

The Hero Xpulse 210 has been officially launched in India at a price of Rs 1.76 lakh. This new model is an upgrade from the Xpulse 200, featuring enhancements for better highway riding and off-road capabilities.

  • New adventure bike priced at Rs. 1.76 lakh.
  • More expensive than Xpulse 200 by Rs. 24,000.
  • Powered by a 210cc, single-cylinder engine with 24.6bhp and 20.7Nm torque.
  • Equipped with a six-speed gearbox and dual-sport motorcycle features.
  • Includes full LED illumination and a 4.2-inch TFT console with smartphone connectivity.
  • Braking hardware consists of front and rear disc brakes with dual-channel ABS.
  • Bookings for the two variants will start soon.
“The increment in the engine capacity and addition of the sixth gear should translate to good highway riding capabilities.”

The Hero Xpulse 210 aims to serve as an ideal option for beginner off-road enthusiasts, following the path set by its predecessor, the Xpulse 200 4V.

item.title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Maruti Suzuki eVitara unveiled! - The Financial Express
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: New Honda Activa Rival Finally Debuts In India! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Suzuki Access Electric Debuts in India

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: MotorOctane

Honda has unveiled its new electric Activa and QC1 scooter, while Suzuki introduces its new electric Access model, marking the entry of a new competitor in the EV scooter segment.

  • The Suzuki Access Electric features a 3.07 kWh battery pack, offering a claimed range of 95 km.
  • It's powered by a 4.1 kW electric motor, achieving a top speed of 71 km/h.
  • Charging time is approximately 4 hours and 30 minutes to reach 80% and 6 hours and 42 minutes for a full charge.
  • The scooter retains a similar design to its ICE counterpart but is based on a new platform with enhanced features.
  • Smart connectivity features, 3 driving modes, and a reverse mode are included.
“The new Access Electric will rival the new Honda Activa e: and Roadster S1 in the country.”

The entry of the Suzuki Access Electric is a significant development in the growing electric scooter market in India, enhancing competition and offering more choices for consumers.

item.title: Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara revealed at Bharat Mobility Expo: Creta EV rival gets 500 km range and more - The Times of India
item.description:
Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara revealed at Bharat Mobility Expo: Creta EV rival gets 500 km range and more

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara was unveiled at the Bharat Mobility Expo, featuring an impressive 500 km range, positioning itself as a competitor to the Creta EV.

  • The e-Vitara boasts a modern design and advanced technology features.
  • It aims to tap into the growing electric vehicle market in India.
  • The vehicle offers various charging options and quick charging capabilities.
  • Environmental impact and sustainability were key themes highlighted during its launch.
“The e-Vitara sets a new benchmark for electric vehicles in India.” - Maruti Suzuki spokesperson

This launch reflects Maruti Suzuki's commitment to expanding its electric vehicle lineup and catering to the rising demand among Indian consumers.

item.title: Trinamool's Mahua Moitra Flags Spoilt Ice Creams In Delivery, Swiggy Responds To Refund Request - NDTV
item.description:
MP Mahua Moitra Addresses Spoilt Ice Cream Delivery, Swiggy Responds

Publication Date: January 16, 2025

Source: NDTV

Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra raised concerns on social media about ice creams she ordered via Swiggy that arrived spoilt. Swiggy responded quickly, asking for her order number to address the issue.

  • Mahua Moitra encountered a delivery problem with spoiled ice creams ordered from Swiggy.
  • She tweeted about her dissatisfaction and expected a refund or replacement.
  • Swiggy promptly acknowledged her complaint and requested further details.
  • The order cost was Rs 1220 for 10 items.
  • Moitra's tweets gained significant attention, prompting varied reactions from the public.
  • She defended her choice to raise the issue publicly, highlighting that MPs are regular consumers.

Hi Mahua, sorry to know that you are facing an issue with your order. Please share the order number. We will look into it.

— Swiggy Cares (@SwiggyCares)

Just because I am an MP doesn't mean I am not a normal person who orders food online. Please get over this mindset that public reps are not normal beings.

— Mahua Moitra (@MahuaMoitra)

The incident has sparked a broader discussion about online food deliveries and consumer expectations.

item.title: Popular 7-Seater Skoda SUV Debuts In India! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Skoda Unveils New 7-Seater SUV and Superb Sedan at Auto Expo 2025 in India

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: MotorOctane

The Auto Expo 2025 kicked off with excitement as Skoda launched the new Kodiaq and Superb for the Indian market, revitalizing its lineup against strong competitors.

  • The new Superb gets a refreshed design with modern headlamps and bumpers, while maintaining its rivalry with the Toyota Camry.
  • The Kodiaq, a 7-seater SUV, competes with the popular Toyota Fortuner and MG Gloster, sporting updates to bumpers and headlamps.
  • Both models share a complete redesign of the interior, featuring a large touchscreen, updated dashboard, and premium materials.
  • Safety features include 9 airbags and advanced driver assistance systems such as automated emergency braking.
  • The Kodiaq is expected to be priced around Rs 55 lakh, while the Superb might go up to Rs 70 lakh due to its CBU import status.
“Skoda has really uplifted the premium quotient with plenty of soft-touch material.”

With the launches set for the coming months, these vehicles aim to enhance Skoda's presence in the competitive Indian SUV market.

item.title: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal responds after user points out Veg Mode enablement fees in the bill - The Times of India
item.description:
Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal responds after user points out Veg Mode enablement fees in the bill

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Deepinder Goyal, CEO of Zomato, has responded to user concerns about additional fees associated with enabling Veg Mode on the app, clarifying the practices around billing.

  • Users noticed extra charges on their bills when Veg Mode was activated.
  • Goyal emphasized the transparency of pricing in the app.
  • The company aims to enhance user experience by addressing feedback on features.
“We value customer feedback and are committed to ensuring clarity in our pricing structure.”

The reaction from users has catalyzed discussions about pricing fairness in food delivery apps.

item.title: RVNL shares jump 5% again today on Budget sops hopes, other railway stocks give up morning gains - Moneycontrol
item.description:
RVNL Shares Surge on Union Budget Hopes

Date: January 17, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The RVNL stock has seen a significant increase, climbing 5% due to favorable expectations surrounding the upcoming Union Budget allocation.

  • RVNL stock surged 5% on January 17, building on an 11% gain from the previous day.
  • The increase is driven by hopes of substantial capital expenditure in the Union Budget 2025-2026, to be presented on February 1.
  • The Ministry of Railways received a record allocation of nearly Rs 2.62 lakh crore in the previous budget.
"Shares of railway stocks have seen heightened activity amid expectations of significant capex increment announcements."

This surge indicates investor optimism but also reflects the volatility of railway stocks in response to budget announcements.

item.title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Live Updates: Should you buy Jio Finance shares ahead of Q3 results today

Date: 17 Jan, 2025

Source: Live Mint

Jio Financial Services is set to announce its Q3 results today, with the share price hovering flat after a significant drop in the past month. The company has experienced a 17% decrease in its stock over the last month, although it has gained 15% over the past year.

  • The stock has fallen 18% in one month.
  • Jio Financial Services reported a net profit of ₹689 crore for Q2FY25.
  • Revenue from operations rose 14% YoY to ₹693.5 crore in Q2FY25.
  • The firm has a market capitalization exceeding ₹1.76 lakh crore.
  • Analysts suggest the stock may be bottoming out and advise buying on dips.
“Jio Finance stock seems to be bottoming out. Traders can buy the stock on dips and at current market price. The first target is ₹300 and the second target is ₹305.” - Ganesh Dongre, Senior Manager - Technical Research at Anand Rathi

In conclusion, Jio Financial Services is expected to play a significant role in the non-banking finance sector. Investors are advised to observe the Q3 results closely, which are likely to influence the stock price moving forward.

item.title: Kia Syros Showcased At Auto Expo 2025 Ahead Of Launch In February - CarDekho
item.description:
Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025: Kia Syros Showcased to the Public Ahead of Launch

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros made its debut at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, showcasing its boxy design and upmarket features ahead of its launch in February 2025.

  • Bookings for the Kia Syros are open for a token amount of Rs 25,000.
  • Price announcement on February 1, 2025, with deliveries starting mid-February.
  • Exterior features include 3-pod LED headlights and L-shaped LED tail lights.
  • Equipped with dual 12.3-inch screens and a panoramic sunroof.
  • Safety features include 6 airbags and a 360-degree camera.
  • Available with a 1-litre turbo-petrol or a 1.5-litre diesel engine.
  • Expected starting price at Rs 9.70 lakh (ex-showroom).

The Kia Syros is positioned between the Kia Sonet and Kia Seltos in India.

This new SUV is expected to attract attention with its features and specifications, positioning itself well in the competitive SUV market.

item.title: India is staring at an 'oil shock' as U.S. sanctions on Russian crude loom - CNBC
item.description:
India Faces Potential Oil Shock Due to U.S. Sanctions on Russian Crude

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: CNBC

India may soon face increased inflation and oil supply challenges due to U.S. sanctions targeting Russian energy companies.

  • U.S. sanctions on Russian oil transport may impact India's oil imports significantly.
  • India imported 40% of its oil from Russia, with expectations of price increases due to limited supply.
  • Impact on Indian refiners is likely to be severe, given the dependency on Russian crude.
  • India's oil consumption is projected to surpass China's by 2025, adding urgency to the situation.
“If India were to fully comply with U.S. sanctions, we could see a sharp decline in Russian crude arrivals in February and potentially March.” - Muyu Xu, Kpler

The ongoing situation highlights India's vulnerability to fluctuations in global oil markets and the potential for domestic economic strain.

item.title: 'Something Wrong In ED' : ASG SV Raju Disowns ED's Affidavit, Says It's Filed Without Verification;... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
ASG SV Raju Questions ED's Counter-Affidavit in Supreme Court

Date: January 17, 2023 | Source: Supreme Court proceedings

Additional Solicitor General SV Raju raised concerns regarding a counter-affidavit filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), claiming it was submitted without proper verification and consultation.

  • SV Raju describes the ED's affidavit as "half-baked" and questions its legitimacy.
  • He accuses the ED of filing the affidavit without verifying facts or consulting the investigatory agency.
  • The Supreme Court bench, comprising Justices Oka and Bhuyan, expressed surprise at these claims.
  • The ASG intends to investigate further and has requested a departmental inquiry into the matter.
  • Justice Oka questioned how the affidavit could be filed without proper instructions from the ED.
“There is something fishy in the filing of the affidavit that is what I found yesterday.” - ASG SV Raju

This situation highlights serious procedural concerns within the ED regarding the submission of legal documents.

item.title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025: Tata Sierra Revealed At Auto Expo 2025, Launch Expected Later This Year - CarDekho
item.description:
Tata Sierra Revealed at Auto Expo 2025 - Launch Expected Later This Year

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: CarDekho.com

The Tata Sierra has made a comeback in its internal combustion engine (ICE) variant at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, showcasing modern design elements while retaining its classic silhouette.

  • The Sierra ICE features an all-new design language, closely resembling its electric counterpart but with alterations to the grille and bumper.
  • Key exterior highlights include connected LED DRLs, flush-type door handles, and connected LED tail lights.
  • The interior is more advanced than that of the Harrier and Safari, featuring three screens on the dashboard.
  • Amenities include a panoramic sunroof, ventilated front seats, and three 12.3-inch screens.
  • Safety features include 6 airbags as standard, a 360-degree camera, and ADAS.
  • Expected to utilize 1.5-litre turbo-petrol and 2-litre diesel engines.
  • Potential pricing starts from Rs 10.50 lakh (ex-showroom).
The Tata Sierra, one of the most iconic brand names in Tata Motors’ history, returns with modern enhancements while honoring its legacy.

In conclusion, the Tata Sierra ICE promises to be a significant addition to Tata’s SUV lineup, blending nostalgia with advanced automotive technology.

item.title: Buy Infosys; target of Rs 2250: Prabhudas Lilladher - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Prabhudas Lilladher Recommends Buy Rating for Infosys with Target Price of Rs 2250

January 17, 2025 / Moneycontrol

Prabhudas Lilladher has issued a buy rating on Infosys with a target price of Rs 2250, due to an anticipated growth in demand and transformation initiatives in the coming years.

  • There are expected mild furloughs in Q4, leading to weaker topline performance.
  • Demand is improving particularly in Europe and the BFS sector.
  • Growth estimates for FY26 and FY27 are projected at 7.7% and 11.8% YoY respectively.
  • The stock is currently trading at a P/E of 23x FY27E, with a target price set for P/E of 27x.
“We maintain BUY.”

The article emphasizes a positive outlook for Infosys with an expected recovery in discretionary spending and anticipated growth in revenues and profits over the next few years.

item.title: 'Time to book profits', an analyst advises on this Nifty 50 stock - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Time to book profits, an analyst advises on this Nifty 50 stock

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm Kotak Institutional Equities has downgraded Tata Group's Trent Ltd. to a 'sell' rating, citing that the expected revenue and EPS growth is already priced into the stock.

  • Kotak downgraded Trent's rating from 'add' to 'sell'.
  • New price target set at ₹5,850, down from ₹6,800, implying a 6% downside.
  • Trent's shares have corrected 25% from their all-time high of ₹8,345.
  • Analyst warns about potential revenue cannibalization from closely located Zudio stores.
  • Revenue and EPS estimates cut by 1-2% and 9-14% respectively for FY 2025-2027.
  • Trent shares have consistently provided positive returns every calendar year for the last decade.
"After the fantastic run-up in the stock price, it may be time to book profits," - Kotak Institutional Equities

Shares of Trent rose 0.8% on Friday, currently at ₹6,259, but have fallen 10% in the past month.

Despite the downgrade, Trent is expected to maintain a healthy revenue CAGR of 29% and EPS CAGR of 35% over the next few years, but Kotak believes these figures are already accounted for in the stock price.

item.title: PM Modi to launch Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, the 2nd edition to witness over 100 launches of automobiles - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Launches Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, set to showcase over 100 new launches in the automobile sector, including components and technologies.

  • The expo will last five days at multiple venues, including Bharat Mandapam and Greater Noida.
  • PM Modi highlighted the impact of infrastructure spending on vehicle demand.
  • He emphasized India's need for advanced mobility solutions and sustainable technologies.
  • The automotive industry is projected to experience significant growth in electric vehicle sales.
  • Over 5 lakh visitors and 5,100 international participants are expected to attend.
“In the last decade, EV sales have seen a 640% growth. By the end of the decade, EV sales are projected to grow by 8 times.” – PM Modi

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 aims to drive innovation and growth in India's mobility sector.

item.title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launch bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 on January 17, 2025 - The Hindu
item.description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Inaugurate Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the second edition of the Bharat Mobility Global Expo on January 17, 2025, showcasing over 100 new launches in the automotive sector.

  • The expo will feature a wide range of participants from the mobility ecosystem including automobile manufacturers, component producers, and software firms.
  • It aims to promote collaboration and innovation in sustainable automotive technology.
  • The event will take place across three venues: Bharat Mandapam, Yashobhoomi, and India Expo Centre & Mart.
  • It is expected to attract over 5 lakh visitors and includes significant launches from major automotive companies.
Overall, more than 40 new product launches are expected at this main attraction of Bharat Mobility Global Expo, 2025.

This expo will be an important platform to highlight advancements in electric vehicles and new innovations in the industry.

item.title: Stocks to buy today: Maruti, Nykaa among top 6 trading ideas for 17 January 2025 - The Economic Times
item.description:
Stocks to Buy Today: Maruti, Nykaa Among Top 6 Trading Ideas for 17 January 2025

Publication Date: 17 January 2025

Source: The Economic Times

The Indian market is expected to consolidate amid muted global cues, with Nifty futures closing at 23,406 with a gain of 0.61%. Experts have recommended several stocks for short-term trading.

  • Recommended stocks include Maruti Suzuki, SBI Cards, SAIL, Hindalco, Aarti Industries, and Nykaa.
  • Nifty has a broader trading range forecasted between 22,800 and 23,700.
  • Immediate trading range is identified between 23,100 and 23,500.
“Nifty formed a small-bodied candle on the daily chart... Now, the index needs to cross and hold above the 23,350 zone for strength to regain towards the 23,500 and 23,700 zones.” - Chandan Taparia, Head of Equity Derivatives & Technicals, MOFSL

This advice serves traders looking for short-term gains through strategic stock picks based on technical analysis.

item.title: Reliance Industries shares gain up to 5% after strong Q3, keep Nifty 50 fall in check - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Reliance Industries Shares Surge 5% Following Strong Q3 Earnings

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: CNBCTV18

Reliance Industries has seen a positive response to its third-quarter earnings report, resulting in a significant increase in its share prices.

  • Shares of Reliance Industries rose up to 5% on January 17, 2025.
  • Brokerage firms upgraded the stock from 'Hold' to 'Buy' based on strong Q3 performance.
  • This comes after a decline of 18% in the last six months.
  • Antique Stock Broking set a new price target of ₹1,456, and Emkay revised their target to ₹1,570.
  • Retail and oil-to-chemical (O2C) sectors drove strong performance; Telecom Ebitda lagged.
  • 33 out of 39 analysts maintain a 'Buy' recommendation for Reliance shares.
“The Q3 beat was driven by strong retail and O2C performance.”

The positive earnings report indicates that Reliance's stock may continue to attract buyers looking for favorable valuations in the market.
